message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.SE 

This paper discusses the security and trust issues in the Named Data Networking (NDN) architecture, which is a network-centric approach to content distribution. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses content poisoning attacks, which fall under the category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Additionally, the paper proposes a trust management architecture, which involves designing and implementing new protocols, making it relevant to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper discusses the design choices made in the trust management architecture, which falls under the category of cs.SE (Software Engineering).
